title: Suspension Electronic Control Module (ECM) - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
If installing a new suspension ECM, the front and rear suspension stroke sensors must be calibrated.
Incorrect calibration of the front and rear suspension stroke sensors may cause an unsafe riding condition resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
If installing a new suspension ECM, the rear preload motor will calibrate automatically after turning the ignition switch ON.
If the rear suspension unit has been removed/refitted, the Triumph Diagnostic Tool must be used to calibrate the rear preload motor.
Turn the ignition to the OFF position and wait at least 1 minute for the engine ECM to complete its power down sequence.
Open the storage box lid, remove the scrivets and move the storage box forwards to detach the locating pins from the rear subframe.
Lift up the storage box, disconnect the USB connector and remove the storage box.
Disconnect the suspension ECM electrical connector (see
Suspension ECM Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
If installing a new suspension ECM, the front and rear suspension stroke sensors must be calibrated.
Incorrect calibration of the front and rear suspension stroke sensors may cause an unsafe riding condition resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
If installing a new suspension ECM, the rear preload motor will calibrate automatically after turning the ignition switch ON.
If the rear suspension unit has been removed/refitted, the Triumph Diagnostic Tool must be used to calibrate the rear preload motor.
Perform the following operations:
Turn the ignition to the OFF position and wait at least 1 minute for the engine ECM to complete its power down sequence.

Battery - Removal
Open the storage box lid, remove the scrivets and move the storage box forwards to detach the locating pins from the rear subframe.

Locating pins
Lift up the storage box, disconnect the USB connector and remove the storage box.
Connector
Disconnect the suspension ECM electrical connector (see
Suspension ECM Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering
) and remove the ECM.
